articles.summary: Professor Wei Shaojun said that Asian countries should develop their own chips to create AI and reduce reliance on general-purpose GPUs that are used to power platforms like ChatGPT and DeepSeek. U.S. curbs have prevented Chinese firms from acquiring cutting-edge chips for several years. Last month, Bloomberg reported that Beijing urged local companies to avoid using NVIDIA Corporation's H20 processors.

articles.title: How the White House defines the AI race with China
articles.author: Dan Primack
articles.summary: Sriram Krishnan is the White House's senior policy advisor for AI. He says the "race" is about the entire AI tech stack and ensuring that most of the world is utilizing the American stack. The imperative is both about economic dominance and national security. The Trump administration's focus on AI market share isn't entirely consistent.

articles.title: Business Insider: Factcheck Your AI Stories Or Else
articles.author: Oliver Darcy via Status
articles.summary: Journalists at Business Insider are allowed to use ChatGPT to write stories, but they must own what they publish under their own name. The policy is part of an aggressive A.I. strategy pushed by the company's German parentco, Axel Springer. BI is the first major newsroom to formalize such far-reaching use of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Rep. Ronny Jackson to Introduce Bill Establishing Military AI Institute – [your]NEWS
articles.author: your NEWS Media Newsroom
articles.summary: The GUARD Act aims to expand President Trump's AI strategy by creating a defense-focused research hub at a senior military college. Texas A&M University could receive support to host the institute if the Act becomes law. The president has consistently tied AI development to national security.

articles.title: Local Schools See A Future With AI Technology
articles.summary: Warsaw Community Schools introduced Skill Struck AI to its staff in the 2023-2024 school year. Wawasee Schools piloted the Magic School program for all its staff last spring with a $10,000 technology grant from IDOE. Fairfield Community Schools is in the planning stages of its AI technology.

articles.title: What You Need to Know About AI and Climate Change
articles.author: Daisy Simmons
articles.summary: As the era-defining technology leapfrogs, it's hard for humans to know what to make of it. AI can track Antarctic icebergs 10,000 times faster than humans and optimize renewable energy grids in real time, but it also consumes a lot of energy. Ann Bostrom, chair of the National Academies of Science's Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence and Climate Change, says it's not clear if AI is good or bad for the climate.

articles.title: Advisors Capital Boosts Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) Holdings by 5.7%

AMD's growth outlook could fuel the stock 50% to 100% over the next 12 months.

articles.title: Acadian Asset Boosts Oracle Corporation (ORCL) Holdings by 5.3%

In just one year, Oracle Corporation delivered a return of 88.27% in contrast to the market's mere return of 17.57%. The biggest growth catalyst for Oracle Corporation is the shift to inferencing from AI training.

The AI chipmaker will buy unsold cloud capacity through April 13, 2032.

articles.title: Hologic (HOLX) Jumps 7.7% on Renewed Billion-Dollar Takeover Bid

articles.title: AptarGroup, Inc. (ATR) Sees Pharma Segment Momentum Driving Record Earnings Growth
articles.author: Laiba Immad

Molecular diagnostics contributed to a 2% core revenue increase, led by Beckman Coulter Diagnostics. The December 2023 acquisition of Abcam, known for its antibody products, added to Life Sciences segment revenue. articles.author: Laiba Immad
articles.summary: Qiagen N.V. (NYSE:QGEN) is a global leader in molecular diagnostics and sample preparation. In Q2 2025, the business reported 7% net sales growth year-over-year. The company plans to launch three new instruments starting in late 2025.

articles.author: Hot Air
articles.summary: Albania has appointed the world's first AI government minister. It's not an AI minister, but a virtual minister made of artificial intelligence. One day, there might be an AI ministry run entirely by AI, as the Babylon Bee reports.

articles.summary: DeepSeek AI's R1 AI model was trained on difficult math, coding and science problems without human guidance. It performed better than older AI models trained with human guidance and achieved an accuracy of 86.7% on the American Invitational Mathematics Examination (AIME) 2024.

articles.summary: Senate Bill 163 would place restrictions on artificial intelligence (AI) in Ohio. It would require watermarks on AI-generated products, bar simulated child pornography and prohibit identity fraud using a replica of a person. The bipartisan bill is sponsored by Sen. Louis Blessing, III, R-District 8, and Sen. Terry Johnson, D-District 14. It is currently in the Senate Judiciary committee.

articles.title: Rep. Ronny Jackson to Unveil Bill Creating Military AI Institute

There are concerns about AI chatbots mishandling sensitive topics.

articles.title: AI, it's the little things

articles.summary: AI is not a well-known phrase but it should be. Sir Keir Starmer talked about 'unleashing' and 'overhauling', and 'sweeping'. Christie & Co's AI in hospitality is about embracing the future. It's about embracing AI.

articles.title: OpenAI says its AI models are schemers that could cause 'serious harm' in the future. Here's its solution.
articles.summary: OpenAI's AI models are capable of "scheming" which is when AI pretends to be aligned with human goals but pursues another agenda. It's better to take preventative action before AI becomes more sophisticated and its scheming could result in real-world harm. The solution is "deliberative alignment" which forces large language models to reason explicitly about safety specifications.

articles.title: Bridging the Gap- On Paradoxes - Holding Two Opposing Views Simultaneously & Still Functioning
articles.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Some fringe or speculative theories suggest that DNA itself may possess a form of "molecular consciousness". Some alternative ideas exist regarding the origin of DNA.

articles.title: Nvidia to Buy $5 Billion Stake in Intel, Giving Rival a Lifeline
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Nvidia, the world's dominant maker of artificial intelligence chips, will invest $5 billion in its struggling rival, Intel, in a deal that illustrates how booming demand for AI is reshaping the global technology industry. The deal is a lifeline for Intel and highlights a reversal of fortune between two Silicon Valley companies. Intel has struggled to keep up with technology shifts to mobile devices and AI. Nvidia, by contrast, has become geopolitically significant, producing the key chips needed for developing AI. The companies will collaborate on developing chips for personal computers and data centers.

articles.title: New Zealand to commit 41 mln USD to accelerate AI research, innovation

The funding will be channeled through the New Zealand Institute for Advanced Technology. AI is transforming economies worldwide and New Zealand must seize the opportunities.

articles.title: WhatsApp: How to delete Metaai?
articles.summary: Users are upset with Meta's AI chatbot, Metaai, which was introduced to WhatsApp, Instagram, and Messenger without an opt-in option. The company is testing a new generation of proactive chatbots on its Messenger and Instagram platforms. WhatsApp is also testing a chatbot based on artificial intelligence.

articles.title: AI chatbots sexually abused Colorado children, leading to one girl's suicide, lawsuits allege
articles.author: Elliott Wenzler
articles.summary: Two lawsuits allege that artificial-intelligence-powered chatbots sexually abused two Colorado teenagers, leading one of them to kill herself. The Social Media Victims Law Center, a legal advocacy organization, filed the federal lawsuits in the Denver Division of the U.S. District Court on Monday. Both name Character Technologies, the company behind Character.AI and its founders, Noam Shazeer and Daniel De Freitas, and Google.

articles.title: Grammarly CEO Shishir Mehrotra Is Building an A.I. Superhighway
articles.author: The Editors
articles.summary: Shishir Mehrotra is the CEO of Grammarly, a platform that brings A.I. agents to users wherever they work. articles.title: Scientists Designed an AI That Doesn't Sap the Power Grid. It Just Needs Light.
articles.summary: ChatGPT users created more than 700 million images in one week back in March 2025. Each query generates about 2-3 grams of CO2. New diffusion model uses laser light as a decoder, which significantly cuts down on computational power and, in turn, energy. It's unlikely that these systems will be integrated widely in the near-term, but they could be useful for wearable systems, such as AI glasses.

articles.title: Letter from the Editor: AI tools used responsibly don't replace journalism, they make it stronger

articles.summary: AI can help journalists move faster, organize better and write more clearly, but it can't replace the human instincts that drive great reporting. The newsroom's challenge is preserving the values that define journalism and separate it from mere information. It's essential to view AI as tools for journalists – not a replacement.

articles.summary: China has blocked its technology firms from purchasing Nvidia's artificial intelligence (AI) chips. It's a strategic move to bolster its homegrown semiconductor sector and reduce reliance on foreign-made chips.      Â   in Menafn.

articles.title: AI with an agenda: when machines begin to scheme
articles.author: Arab News
articles.summary: In the grand narrative of technological advancement, few moments are as disconcerting or awe-inspiring as the realization that our machines are no longer merely tools, but agents with tactics. Most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.

articles.title: Meta AI Dings Kirk for Supposed Misinformation, Citing and Praising ‘Neutral' Wikipedia
articles.author: Tom Olohan
articles.summary: Meta AI went after Turning Point USA Founder Charlie Kirk by relying on Wikipedia. The chatbot accused Kirk of promoting conspiracy theories and other purportedly false claims. Wikipedia justified its choice by stating it offers a 'neutral point of view and comprehensive coverage of current events'

articles.title: Free AI skills training available through Goodwill
articles.author: Vicky
articles.summary: Goodwill of the Heartland is offering free access to the new Google AI Essentials training course. It covers how to use artificial intelligence (AI) tools effectively in everyday work. The online course takes about six hours to complete and is packed with interactive lessons, videos and real-world examples. Upon completion, learners receive a certificate from Google that can be shared with employers.
